private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
I must move at most one disk at a time.
I cannot move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
agent_1.goal: Help reach the target configuration where left peg has (top->bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

private_information: I can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
I must move at most one disk at a time.
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
agent_2.goal: Help reach the target configuration where left peg has (top->bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has A; right peg has B.

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and must integrate their proposed moves into a final plan.
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver representing the environment and the final goal.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a verified cooperative plan and a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieve the target configuration while keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg holds disks top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg holds disks top to bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg holds A; right peg holds B.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Based on the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can legally perform under Tower of Hanoi rules. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each primitive move. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move. If you propose no moves, return an empty list.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: There are three pegs left, middle, right. Initial configuration has left peg top->bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Goal: left peg top->bottom C..O, middle has A, right has B. You can move A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H. Provide a minimal ordered list of primitive moves you will perform to contribute to the global goal, in the exact line format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Based on the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can legally perform under Tower of Hanoi rules. Use the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each primitive move. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move. If you propose no moves, return an empty list.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: There are three pegs left, middle, right. Initial configuration has left peg top->bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Goal: left peg top->bottom C..O, middle has A, right has B. You can move I,J,K,L,M,N,O. Provide a minimal ordered list of primitive moves you will perform to contribute to the global goal, in the exact line format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the move proposals from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that models the three pegs, the fifteen labeled disks, the Tower of Hanoi rules, the initial configuration, and the goal configuration. Keep agent actions distinct in the model where applicable. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should be self-contained and explicitly target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the ordered primitive moves from each agent and must verify they are legal under the Tower of Hanoi rules and then produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that represents the task and goal. Integrate the inputs {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2} and ensure the final PDDL captures the initial state and the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
expected_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
